text: Vivian Mildred Bailey ( Corbett; February 3, 1918 â€“ May 1, 2022) was an American World War II veteran, civil servant, and volunteer. She was a fundraiser for education, health, and military service personnel. Bailey was one of the first African American officers in the Women's Army Corps. She was a commander of the Women's Colored Detachment. Bailey was a division director in the Social Security Administration. Bailey turned 100 in February 2018. She died in Ellicott City, Maryland, on May 1, 2022, at the age of 104. ==References== Category:1918 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:American centenarians Category:Military people from Washington, D.C.
title: Millie Bailey
